caption:
This photograph captures an intense and dynamic scene of whitewater rafting. Several individuals in the raft are navigating through a turbulent section of a river. The river is filled with frothy, white waves that splash around, indicating strong currents and rapids. The raft appears partially submerged by a large wave, showcasing the challenging conditions of the activity.

In the raft, there appear to be at least three people visible. They are equipped with safety helmets and life vests, indicating an emphasis on safety amidst the adventurous activity. One of the rafters, who is visible and facing towards the camera, is gripping a paddle, actively engaged in steering or stabilizing the raft.

The background of the photo shows rocky and rugged riverbanks, suggesting a secluded, natural setting typical of river rafting locations. The photograph captures a moment full of action and excitement, emphasizing the adventurous spirit of the participants as they maneuver through the challenging waters.
title: Small (17-foot) raft running Wild Sheep Rapids on the Snake River in Hells Canyon. Expert boatmen working for commercial river-running companies provide a safety margin. Rarely do these rafts capsize even in waters as dangerous as those shown here.
